intro: Vermeulenia papilionacea var. heroica, commonly known as the Heroic Snapdragon, is a strikingly ornamental plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant, spurred flowers that range in color from deep red to purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its role in local ecosystems.
